title: (x) Whitney Museum sans serif - Cachet {Stephen}
content:
What is the sans type used by the Whitney Museum for their catalogs/signage/website etc...   
   
I have checked H&FJ Whitney, but that's not it - just look at "e" and "C". (When did they stop using H&FJ whitney anyway?)   
   
Here's a pretty crude scan (it has an unusual comma and diamond-shaped punctuation)   
   
 ![Sans serif used by Whitney Museum](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528000825im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/70751.jpg) ![Sans serif used by Whitney Museum, eg2](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528000825im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/70752.jpg)
author: ebukva
